title.rendered: Singer Alka Yagnik Diagnosed with Rare Hearing Loss.

content.rendered:
Alka Yagnik shared an update on her health and asked her “fans, friends, followers, and well-wishers” to pray for her as she revealed that she was suffering from sensorineural hearing loss.

Alka Yagnik – one of the leading singers in Bollywood in the 90s with hundreds of songs to her credit, from Madhuri Dixit to Sridevi – said that she discovered that she had “a rare sensorineural nerve hearing loss”, due to “sudden loss of body tissue”. viral attack’. In a long post on Instagram on Monday, the singer told his friends and well-wishers revealed why he was “missing” and asked for “support and understanding.” Alka’s last Instagram post was on Mother’s Day 2024 in May.

“I was totally surprised”

Alka started by writing next to a picture of herself with no end in sight: “To all my supporters, friends, followers and supporters. In the last few weeks But when I got off the plane, I couldn’t hear anything. Gaining courage in the weeks following the event, I wanted to be silent for all my friends and supporters who asked me why I was losing my battle. My doctors diagnosed a rare neurological deafness, due to a bacterial attack… this sudden and severe setback took me completely by surprise.

“Please keep me in your prayers.”

He added: “As I try to do this, please keep me in your prayers.” The singer went on to share a warning against “exposing music on headphones.” Alka said: “For my supporters and young colleagues, I would add a word of caution about listening to music on headphones.

One day, I want to share the health risks of my professional life. With all your love and support, I hope to rebuild my life and come back to you soon. Your support and understanding will mean the world to me during this critical hour…”

Read Also: Historic moment! Sabyasachi becomes 1st Indian designer to walk on Met Gala red carpet
